subject: Investing
title: Revenue vs. Profit: Know the Difference
description: One-minute skill: Revenue vs. Profit: Know the Difference.

hook.text: A company reports $10 billion in revenue. Impressive? Not if it spent $11 billion to earn it.

buildup.text: Revenue is total sales. Profit is what's left after all costs. Revenue is vanity; profit is sanity.

discovery.text: Gross profit removes production costs. Operating profit removes overhead. Net profit removes everything.

twist.text: Amazon reported tiny profits for 20 years while revenue soared. It was reinvesting everything into growth.

climax.text: Profit margins tell the real story. A 30% margin means 30 cents of every dollar becomes profit.

punchline.text: Revenue opens the door. Profit decides if you stay in business.

quiz.question: What is the difference between revenue and profit?
options: Revenue is total sales; profit is what remains after costs
Profit is always larger than revenue
